Comments_List: The only critique I have of the course was that it would have been helpful to have a class towards the beginning of the course providing an overview of different types of objects that have been termed "fetishes," since many of the members of the class had had little prior experience studying African art and material cultures.

Yes, absolutely!  I learned a great deal not only about West African material cultures, but also about European Enlightenment-era discourse, African history, the diverse cultures of the Black Atlantic, and histories of collecting and museums, among many other topics. I was impressed by the breadth and variety of material that Prof. Fromont was able to cover in a single semester.
